description.narrative: The main objective of this project is emergence of youth leaders, both men and women, that will play active role in civil society empowerment towards the resilience of Inle Lake-watershed ecosystem. It will work with 108 villages (out of 179) in 13 Village tracts of Nyaung Shwe Township in Southern Shan State. It has 4 components: 1. Community Awakening: Increased people#s participation inwatershed rehabilitation and lake conservation related issues through community mobilizing by local youth group 2. Participatory Action Research on Biodiversity and Aquatic Resources Management: enhanced community participation in action research and planning on common pool resource management through promoting the indigenous knowledge 3. Appropriate Technology for income generation opportunities and improving water quality: increased income generating opportunities for vulnerable local youth and enhanced improving water quality 4. Networking capacity for Advocacy: improved cooperation and networking of Hnalone Hla Inn Maung Mae with other different stakeholders on watershed management

participating-org.narrative:
In 2008, KMF began coordinating with Buddhist youth across the country to strengthen their capacity to actively get involved in community development and social change projects through the Buddhist Youth Empowerment Program (BYEP). Having secures its registrationrecently, it is thus an organization run by youth, and serving the interest of youth. KMF#s mission is to support youth to facilitate and co-create a sustainable future together in Myanmar. Kalayana Mitta is a pali word meaning #good friends#. KMF is grounded in a socially engaged buddhist perspective that encourages compassion, understanding and solidarity among the diversity of ethnic and religious identities in Myanmar. This perspective is also underscored by an understanding that such valuesprovide a strong foundationfor sustainable social change. Over the past six years KMF has provided: (1)Awareness raising, leadership and specific skills for youth based on engaged buddhist approaches.
(2) Small start-up grants to local youth groupsfor initiating community development projects after completing training. These local youth groups have since formed into Alumni Core Groups (ACGs) now numbering 21.
(3) Organizational development support for the ACG#s to ensure that accountable and participatory organisational structures and democratic practices are in place.
Given increase in communal violence, interfaith activities have also been integrated into the KMF programme that build on a strategy of collaborating across diverse faiths and ethnic groups in order to establish common ground and build partnerships for working together as good friends for the benefit of society.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: no. of women and men (small-scale crop farmers, cattle farmers, fisher folk) able to use sustainable production methods enabling them to better protect and use sustainably their livelihood resources
